intro: Hieracium minuriens, commonly known as the small yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and hairy, sometimes glandular leaves. Native to Europe, it is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and has a basal rosette of leaves. It is a perennial species that blooms from late spring to early autumn.
